attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.description:
A physical stock take was conducted on 12.02.2025 with the aim of establishing whether internal controls were effective and whether physical stock items were matching with those in the SAP system. 

     After stock take, it was noted that most stock items had nil variations with exception to;

Ø  Bread stock had -79 pieces cumulatively

Ø  Poly bags had a variance of +519 cumulatively

Ø  Wheat bran variance of -1.192 kgs

      Details of the findings were as illustrated  in the table below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should maintain control of stock items by regularly taking stock and making follow ups in case of variances.
attributes.effect: At the time of stock take, there were controls to safeguard the company’s assets as depicted by minimal variances in most items.
attributes.remediation_plan: Regular stock take by the branch manager and report on variances

value: We do make stock follow ups on daily basis so as to ensure physical stock align with what is in the system.
We will enhance control so as to reduce variance noted in bread.
In a prior audit report bread had a variance of -20.5 loaves and polybags -419 pieces
Current
A physical stock take was conducted on 12.02.2025 with the aim of establishing whether internal controls were effective and whether physical stock items were matching with those in the SAP system.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description:
Bread produced and packed in the branch were weighed randomly to determine if bread dispatched to the market was of the correct weight.

     From the sample selected audit noted that all varieties weighed had underweight cases with exception to 400g Supa Nutri which had no underweight cases as illustrated in the table below;
attributes.effect: Underweight bread dispatched to market exposes the company to risk of penalties if they are intercepted by the weight and measures officials.
attributes.remediation_plan: A follow up on underweight cases should be followed up by branch manager so as to know the root cause and rectify it.

value: We will enhance spot checks from the dividing table to packing to ensure set standards on dividing and packing are strictly adhered to.
We will enhance control by doing spot checks so as to achieve set weight.
In a prior audit report cases of underweight were noted as follows; 400g ctw-17% and 600g white – 5%
Current
Bread produced and packed in the branch were weighed randomly to determine if bread dispatched to the market was of the correct weight.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Damages Check
attributes.description:
An analysis of production and market/supermarket damages was done to determine whether they were within the allowed percentage of 0.2% to total production and 0.5% of total sales respectively.

     A sample period of 42 days (1 January 2025 to 11 February 2025) was used to analyse bread damages. Audit noted that the percentage of average production damages stood at 0.23% of the total production while average market damages was 0.41% of total sales as illustrated in the table below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should control bread damages by ensuring all production procedures are being followed and bread produced is of good quality so as to reduce production damages.
attributes.effect: Production bread damages were above set limits meaning the company had lost revenue amounting to Ksh 19,695.65 {[(0.03*3,020)/0.23]*53} through excess damages.
attributes.remediation_plan: Properly Maintain the Equipment and ensuring all production procedures are followed

value: We are trying our best to reduce bread damages in the branch by ensuring we produce quality bread.
I will advise the manager and supervisors to ensure all set production procedures are followed so as to  reduce cases of damages
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Mixing charts and mixing chart summaries from 1 January 2025 to 11 February 2025 were examined to find out the branch’s utto consumption, average yield, cases of remix and summation of totals

          After examining the records the follow were noted;

Ø  Average yield per bag was191.23loaves per bag.

Ø  Utto consumption was at 100%.

ØAverage production was 162.14 bags per day representing 83.15% of target which is 195 bags per day (Branch Capacity)

    The table below illustrates the findings;

     Audit further noted that details in mixing charts in some days were different from those transferred to mixing chart summaries. Below are some of the cases noted;

Ø  02.01.25 Chart for unit 1 first shift had 19 bags but the summary had 18 bags

Ø  10.01.25 chart for unit 1 3 shift had 40 bags  while mixing chart summary had 38 bags

Ø  In some cases mixes recorded were being cancelled (14 & 16.01.25)
attributes.recommendation:
On those days the branch run on full capacity, the branch management should ensure production target is achieved. Through market promotions, new customers within the existing routes may be reached which in turn will increase production

Number of loaves produced per mix  should only be recorded after dividers have finished dividing as this will control cases of cancellation of mixes and recording more mixes yet they were not done
attributes.effect:
Target production in bags was not achieved meaning the branch’s capacity was underutilized.

       By transferring different bags to have been produced to the summary implied that there was no follow up
attributes.remediation_plan:
The branch manager should check mixing charts and summary daily after stock to ensure figures transferred to charts are matching.

on the other hand the supervisors should check record of each mix to ensure loaves indicated to have been produced and recorded by divider or mixer are matching with physical count in baking tins and then sign against each mix.

value:
Our production mainly depend on sales. Therefore we produce as per market demands so as to control balances

   We will eliminate these cases by following up by supervisors confirming each mix after dividing

We produce as per market demand so as to control bread balance which in turn affect target achievement.

   Action will be taken in case this issue continuous as the supervisors are supposed to check each mix after dividing.
Current
Mixing charts and mixing chart summaries from 1st January 2025 to 11th February 2025 were examined to find out the branch’s utto consumption, average yield, cases of remix and summation of totals
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Cash Count
attributes.description:
A spot check in the cash office was carried out with the aim of ensuring cash at hand was tallying with that of the cash flow balance.

      It was noted that the cashier fully accounted for the expected cash balance of Ksh 220,843.50 (Ksh 209,043.50 plus Ksh 11,800 for NSSF and SHIF amount which was cashed in) as at 14/02/2025. At the time of cash count NSSF and SHIF amount which had been collected was Ksh 10,600 and Ksh 1,200 respectively.
attributes.recommendation: The cashier should maintain the controls.
attributes.effect: Cash well controlled and set procedures are followed
attributes.remediation_plan: Controls in place should maintained and strengthen.

value: Cash was well controlled.
Cash well controlled.
Current
A spot check in the cash office was carried out with the aim of ensuring cash at hand was tallying with that of the cash flow balance.
Cash well controlled as at the time of spot check
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Debtors
attributes.description:
Outstanding debts were analysed as at 16 February 2025 to check the magnitude

  It was observed that total outstanding debt was Ksh 967,459.72 as illustrated in Appendix 2 below;
attributes.recommendation: A follow up should be made by sales rep to ensure customers with debt do pay and clear the outstanding balances
attributes.effect: Customers with debts exposes the company to risk of losing its revenue if they do not have security deposit to cover up for the outstanding balances.
attributes.remediation_plan: For institutions, credit policy should be set and acted upon. for individual customers, payment should be made after delivery and they should be encouraged to contribute security deposit to cover the same when they are not able to pay. Extra cents for those regular customers should be used to clear debt

value: The Sales rep is following up so as the balances are cleared
Communication and follow up being made with Sales team.
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Production efficiency calculation from 2 January 2025 to 11 February 2025 was done to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker

       It was noted that the average production efficiency was 4.48 bags per production worker as illustrated in the table below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should allocate production workers as per production target shift wise so as to ensure set efficiency is achieved
attributes.effect: The branch did not achieve the set production efficiency target meaning that the cost of production was above set budget
attributes.remediation_plan: To achieve set production efficiency target through A Performance Improvement Plan

value: We are trying our best so as to achieve set target of 4.5 bags per production worker.
Will put more effort to get production efficiency 4.5 bags per person.
From prior audit report average production efficiency was 4.46 bags per production worker
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Packing efficiency was calculated from 2 January 2025 to 11 February 2025.The aim was to determine if the packers hired were achieving the set packing efficiency of 97 crates per packer.

      It was noted that the average packing efficiency was 91.61 crates per packer as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: Hiring of Packers shift wise should be guided by the number of bags produced in the prior shift. This will enable the branch to achieve set target
attributes.effect: Average packing efficiency was below the set target and this implies that packing cost was above the set budget hence an extra cost to the company
attributes.remediation_plan: Number of Packers should strictly be hired after  taking into consideration number of loaves produced in prior shift.

value: Packing efficiency was affected by oven breakdown. However, we are trying our best to achieve set target.
Will push to get set target for packing efficiency.
From prior audit report average packing efficiency was 96.35 crates per packer
Current
Packing efficiency was calculated from 2nd January 2025 to 11th February 2025.The aim was to determine if the packers hired were achieving the set packing efficiency of 97 crates per packer.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage and Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of fuel consumption was done from 1 January 2025 to 14 February 2025 to assess;

Ø  Whether the standard fuel consumption set for each vehicle was being met

 It was noted that for the month of January 2025 the Turbo route vehicle used more fuel by 10.63 litres while for the month of February 2025 turbo and Baraton routes vehicles over consumed by 9.69 litres and 8.46 litres respectively as illustrated  below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch manager should control fuel usage and in case the vehicle in a given route is consuming more than the set standard a retest should be done or check be done why it’s using more fuel
attributes.effect: Over consumption of fuel is an extra cost to the company as it is more expensive to supply bread when the vehicle uses more fuel than set standard
attributes.remediation_plan: For those vehicles which do not meet set target on fuel consumption, retesting should be done after checking the root cause

value: We are trying to control fuel usage in the branch with only Turbo route where we are having challenges

Vehicle fuel well controlled in most vehicles with exception with Turbo route vehicle but we will check what might be the reasons why vehicles in this route consume more so as to come up with solution.

Analysis of fuel consumption was done from 1st January 2025 to 14th February 2025 to assess;

Ø  Whether the standard fuel consumption set for each vehicle was being met
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
The generator consumption rate was reviewed from 1 to 14 February 2025 to establish and determine the consumption rate. For the period reviewed fuel consumption rate was 38.25L/hr, the generator had run for 2.85 hours and 109 litres of fuel were bought.

·     Audit noted that the number of hours as per the generator odometer (engine hours) as at 14 February 2025 was 103hrs 56 minutes while the system was say the 2,807.22 hrs
attributes.recommendation: A follow up with system providers should be done so that the system calibration is checked to ensure the information is matching with the one on the ground in terms of clock hours run
attributes.effect: By the system fiving different hours different from what the odometer was displaying implies that calibration was not done correctly.
attributes.remediation_plan: The system provider should be asked to calibrate the system so that its recordings match with physical reading

value: We will follow up with Maintenance personnel so as the same is communicated to service providers
We will follow up with Maintenance personnel so as the same is communicated to service providers.
Current
Operations/Production Department
